intro: Eschscholzia bicornuta, commonly known as the two-horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers with two prominent lobes on the petals. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a taproot system that helps it survive in arid conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and upright. The two-horned poppy is also known for its medicinal properties, with some parts of the plant used in traditional herbal remedies.
